Posts.Content: Hi all I am taking Letrzone and was offered a dexa scan by my consultant because of the risk of osteoarthritis , had it before I finished my rads. Hope you all get your scans
Posts.Title: bone scan question

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline I finished my rads two weeks ago and honestly there is nothing to be scared of, I am the biggest wimp going but the team were so kind to me and explained everything that was going to happen. They played music in the room so it relaxes you and I even got as far as joking with the nurses about my favourite football team. I was lucky in having a lift every day because I did get tired but the sunburn is not as bad as you think. I am now in the weepy stage too fiddley fingers and get very cross with myself because all in all I have been very lucky . Good luck to you all and be proud of your little black dots ( which incidentally do not hurt) x
Posts.Title: About to start Radiotherapy in a couple of weeks. Help!

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief Thanks for the advice I am having my RT at Ipswich hospital is that anywhere near you ?
Posts.Title: hot sweats during radio therapy

Posts.Content: I had my CT scan after seeing my oncologist if that helps any, and have just finished radiotherapy last week .
Posts.Title: CT Scan

Posts.Content: I got a months sick note from my GP before I even had the op but the hospital staff also offered to write one for me as well so don't worry you will get one, good luck and let us know how your surgery goes x
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hi Murphy I had my WLE and SNB on June 26th but did not really feel up to going back to work until a month later , I work in a high school office which is very demanding due to dealing with teenagers all day :-) luckily I am now on 6 weeks break but my RT started yesterday which will peak just as I am due to go back to work :-( I am not going to rush into anything if this has taught me one thing its look after yourself and don't expect too much of yourself. I have good days and bad but on the whole good so please don't rush back to work just for the sake of it. X
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hello all I am post surgery and radiotherapy by 4 months and hopefully all is well, but just recently my arm, chest and underarm have become very sore. Almost like I've pulled muscles somewhere, I do my exercises religiously and cream the affected side. So why do I feel like I can hardly move ? Is this a radiotherapy side effect ? Am having to take pain killers to get me through the day. I feel more stiff now than when I first had surgery. Anyone got any ideas as I don't want to go to my doctor unless I really have to. Thanks all happy christmas x
Posts.Title: Sore arm, chest and underarm

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying admin, I went to the doctors today and apparently I have strained my shoulder muscles somehow either by stretching or lifting , hopefully pain killers and anti inflammatory will sort it out or its the physio for me in the new year. I guess I am still not quite back to normal yet but fingers crossed I will be soon. Happy Christmas
Posts.Title: Sore arm, chest and underarm

Posts.Content: Hi I have just finished week 1 of rads and so far so good but I know I will get some side effects before long. Have you mentioned this pain to the radiotherapy nurses ? I get asked every day if I am getting any problems . Good luck and let me know how it goes x
Posts.Title: rads and pain!!!

Posts.Content: Hi I have now finished week 2 and am getting red sore skin under my boob and along the rib cage, when I asked today about it they said it was perfectly normal and just keep slapping on the cream. Sandi please believe its a doddle there is no pain with the treatment its just as time goes on it seems to get a bit sore but hey after everything we have all been through this is nothing xc
Posts.Title: rads and pain!!!
